titlestmt.titleproper: Francis Clark Wood Institute for the History of Medicine records 1948-2004
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Francis Clark Wood Institute for the History of Medicine records

bioghist.p: The Francis Clark Wood Institute for the History of Medicine was established by the College of Physicians of Philadelphia in 1976 to promote to the scholarly community the rich historical resources of the Historical Library and the MÃ¼tter Museum . The Institute sponsors conferences and a seminar series and offers resident research fellowships to scholars who require the use of the College's historical resources.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes administrative and financial records for the Wood Institute, as well as photographic documentation and printed materials. Materials include: director's files; manuscripts, production files and correspondence related to Transactions and Studies; files on Wood Institute fellows, scholars in residence, and interns; program planning documentation, including files related to the Law and Medicine program; grant proposals and reports; budget planning and financial records; minutes and other documentation related to College of Physicians departments and Committees; and Wood Institute and non-Wood Institute printed materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
